results.title: Just like you
results.creator_credit: Eugene Osborne Smith and Stephen Bosustow Productions
results.brief_description: Society is made up of all sorts of people who share common hopes and dreams. Each person should be able to advance according to ability. However, the difference between people create conflicts and barriers that hinder the success of some. A montage of photographs accompanied by the poem ‘Just Like You’ presents these concepts.

results.title: Just like machines
results.creator_credit: Tasmanian Film Corporation and Don Anderson
results.brief_description: Instructs on safe methods of handling pesticides, their application and storage. Stresses that the Department of Agriculture should be contacted for advice as to which pesticide to use for which pest, when there is doubt as to identity. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Just desserts
results.creator_credit: Monica Pellizzari and NRG Films Australia
results.brief_description: This delicious comedy about an Italo-Australian girl’s sexual awakening and her love for her mama’s cooking is written, produced and directed by Monica Pellizzari. Through the use of a split screen which separates the food from the experience, issues such as menstruation, masturbation, lesbianism and virginity are explored, against a backdrop of broth, venetian fritters, polenta, dumplings and pizza. Cast includes Dina Panozzo and Anne-Louise Lambert.

results.title: Just Australian Planes
results.brief_description: Narrated by Aden Wickes, Senior Check Captain with Qantas, this film contains extraordinary rare footage of different kinds of aeroplanes, past and present, and their respective pilots. It charts a unique aeronautical journey in time, from the beginnings of the RAAF to the more fanciful, high tech aircraft of today.

results.title: Just an accident
results.creator_credit: Carol Haslam, BBC-TV and Open University
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Introduction to Psychology”.
Concerned with the experimental investigation of human factors in road accident causation. Considers individual differences in hazard perception, the problem of where the driver pays attention within the visual field, and how the driver deals with a hazard which has been seen.

results.title: Just a trace
results.creator_credit: Shan Benson, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Jack Rogers
results.brief_description: Just a trace of some element - cobalt, copper, or molybdenum can give rich pasture and healthy sheep where until recently the desert defied the farmer. The film shows how South Australian areas once fit only for scrub have been transformed into prosperous farms. Many countries, as well as Australia, are now benefiting from the important research work in this field undertaken by Commonwealth Scientific and Industrial Research Organisation.

results.title: Just a patch of scrub
results.creator_credit: World Wide Fund for Nature Australia
results.brief_description: Overviews traditional problems with the land including clearing, soil erosion and salinity. Discusses the importance of preserving and benefits of remnant native vegetation and shows the revegatation of a wasteland area where land had been cleared. Includes comprehensive teaching notes.

results.title: Jupiter and Saturn
results.creator_credit: David P. Stone and Coastal Community Colleges
results.brief_description:
Episode number 23 of Series “Universe: the infinite frontier: an introductory astronomy telecourse”.
Jupiter is the largest planet in our solar system, and unlike Earth is a gaseous rather than terrestial planet, largely composed of hydrogen and helium. An enormous planet, Jupiter spins very fast and has a strong magnetic field. Its famous red spot is in fact a huge storm travelling across the planet’s surface. Jupiter’s moons, in particular Io, Europa and Gannymede are examined in this program. Scientists were amazed to find, that like Saturn, Jupiter had rings. Saturn, with its famous rings, is very similar in composition to Jupiter. It’s rings, seen by early astronomers, are largely made of ice and number into the thousands. Saturn’s moons such as Titan, are also highlighted in this program because of their diversity.

results.title: Jungle road
results.brief_description: Papua and New guinea today, showing the terrain, people and customs; technical training of the natives; development of agricultural schemes and health services carried out by the New Guinea administration; role of the Twenty-First Construction Squadron of Royal Australian Engineers building new roads, providing electric power and telephone services, constructing houses, a jetty and an airstrip. A new road being built through the rugged Torricelli Mountain range from Wewak to Maprik.
